name: DrawQuest Closes Down After Security Breach
caption: thenextweb.com
description: The app had lived on despite losing its team, but a security breach has ultimately hastened its closure.

data.message:
Failure to monetize will always result in a closure. I'm happy it's getting some media coverage, should be a reality check for anyone thinking that it's a matter of slamming a website online and then claiming they're a business.
Quite frankly, the only bubble I see in this industry is the hyperbole shit of "entrepreneurship for all". No different than "Everyone should learn how to code". Just more bullshit.

Also not to forget, they've had some moderate levels of success. For half a million active users a month, that's not bad. Below what's dubbed as average but still solid enough for a series A if they weren't bootstrapping. However, if one can't capitalize, one should go home.
